slides.content:
# Introduction to Artificial Intelligence

Welcome to **Artificial Intelligence** - machines that learn!

## What You Will Learn:
- **AI Basics** - What is AI?
- **Machine Learning** - Learning from data
- **Neural Networks** - Brain-inspired computing
- **Applications** - Real-world uses

> **Fun Fact:** ChatGPT has over 100 million users!

slides.title: AI Basics
slides.content:
# AI Basics

## Definition:
Systems that can perform tasks requiring human intelligence.

## Types of AI:

| Type | Description |
|------|------------|
| Narrow AI | Specific task (current) |
| General AI | Human-level (future) |
| Super AI | Beyond human (hypothetical) |

## AI vs ML vs DL:
```
AI (broadest)
  -> Machine Learning
       -> Deep Learning (neural networks)
```

## Brief History:
- 1950: Turing Test
- 1956: AI term coined
- 1980s: Expert systems
- 2012: Deep learning revolution
- 2020s: Large language models

slides.title: Machine Learning
slides.content:
# Machine Learning

## Definition:
Algorithms that improve through experience (data).

## Types:

| Type | Training | Example |
|------|----------|--------|
| Supervised | Labeled data | Classification |
| Unsupervised | No labels | Clustering |
| Reinforcement | Rewards/penalties | Games |

## Supervised Learning:
- Classification: Categorize (spam/not spam)
- Regression: Predict continuous value (price)

## Common Algorithms:

| Algorithm | Use |
|-----------|-----|
| Linear Regression | Predict values |
| Decision Trees | Classification |
| Random Forest | Ensemble method |
| SVM | Classification |
| k-NN | Classification |

slides.title: Neural Networks
slides.content:
# Neural Networks

## Structure:
- Input layer
- Hidden layers
- Output layer
- Neurons connected by weights

## How They Learn:
1. Forward pass: Compute output
2. Calculate error (loss)
3. Backpropagation: Adjust weights
4. Repeat until good performance

## Deep Learning:
- Many hidden layers
- Learns complex features
- Requires lots of data and compute

## Types:

| Architecture | Use |
|--------------|-----|
| CNN | Images |
| RNN/LSTM | Sequences, text |
| Transformer | Language, attention |
| GAN | Generate content |

slides.title: AI Applications
slides.content:
# AI Applications

## Computer Vision:
- Image recognition
- Object detection
- Facial recognition
- Medical imaging

## Natural Language Processing:
- Translation
- Chatbots
- Sentiment analysis
- Text generation (GPT)

## Other Applications:

| Field | Application |
|-------|------------|
| Healthcare | Diagnosis, drug discovery |
| Finance | Fraud detection, trading |
| Transportation | Self-driving cars |
| Entertainment | Recommendations |

## Ethics Concerns:
- Bias in data/models
- Privacy
- Job displacement
- Deepfakes
- Explainability

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# AI Summary

## Machine Learning Types:
| Type | Data |
|------|------|
| Supervised | Labeled |
| Unsupervised | Unlabeled |
| Reinforcement | Rewards |

## Neural Networks:
- Layers of connected neurons
- Learn through backpropagation
- Deep learning: Many layers

## Key Architectures:
- CNN: Images
- RNN/Transformer: Text/sequences

## Applications:
- Vision, language, healthcare, autonomous systems

## Ethics:
- Bias, privacy, transparency

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Artificial Intelligence!
